content.text:
# Draft:Leaders and civilizations in the Civilization series

The Civilization videogame series, previously known as Sid Meier's Civilization, is a videogame series that began with the release of the 1991 videogame titled Civilization. The main Civilization videogames center around the idea of creating a civilization that "stands the test of time", from prehistoric times and into the future. The Civilization series forms part of a videogame genre known as 4X, were players control a faction and have to explore, expand, exploit and exterminate to advance in the objectives of the game. Throughout the first six installments of the series, the player chooses a civilization, and its corresponding leader, as their playable character and has to face the other civilizations and leaders featured in each game. For the seventh installment of the series, players can mix and match civilizations and leaders. regardless of the historical ties between them.
Leaders
Throughout the years, the Civilization series has featured various factions loosely referred to in game by the name of civilizations, or civs. They represent various forms of historical human groups, such as cultural or ethnic groups, sovereign states, archeological cultures, empires, etc.
